Of course! Here are some tips to make the fragrance last longer throughout the day:

1. Apply fragrance to pulse points: Fragrance is activated by body heat, so apply it to pulse points like the wrists, neck, and temples.

2. Apply to moisturized skin: Apply fragrance to moisturized skin after taking a shower, as dry skin doesn't hold fragrance very well.

3. Layer your fragrance: Layer your fragrance by using the same scented body wash and lotion as your perfume, but use them sparingly so that the scent doesn't become overwhelming.

4. Choose long-lasting fragrances: Choose fragrances with long-lasting notes like musk, amber, and patchouli, which tend to last longer on the skin.

5. Refresh throughout the day: Reapply fragrance throughout the day to keep the scent fresh, especially if you're going out in the evening.

Remember, however, not to overdo it! Using too much fragrance can be overwhelming and unpleasant for those around you.
